conclusion: Use the first law of thermodynamics: ΔU = Q - W
Given ΔU = 200 J; process involves A to B (isobaric) and B to C (isochoric)
From the diagram: P = 3 x 10^5 Pa, V_A = 1 x 10^-3 m^3, V_B = 4 x 10^-3 m^3
Calculate ΔV: V_B - V_A = 3 x 10^-3 m^3
Calculate work done W_AB = PΔV = 900 J
No work done during B to C (isochoric), W_BC = 0
Total work done W = W_AB + W_BC = 900 J
Apply first law: Q = ΔU + W
Substitute values: Q = 200 J + 900 J = 1100 J
Final answer: Heat exchanged Q = 1100 J
